result.execSummary:
The defendant Olen Mack Brewer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Olen Mack Brewer

records.addlTxt: to Reduce Charge to Ordinance Violation
Status conference on August 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:19 p.m.  Court calls cases, 22CT9 and 22CM22.  Def present in person.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State.  Def failed to appear this a.m. and warrant was authorized.  Court quashes warrant.  Def states slept through alarm.  Court reads charges.  Def has rcvd complaint.  Def. understands rt to atty.  Def representing himself.  Def pleads guilty.  In 22CM22, DA indicates a stip has been done.  Will email to def again.  Def accepted terms.  DA states what offer is.  No jail, just fines of $443.50.  Court goes through rights.  Def understands and waives right to atty.  Court allows waiver.  Court goes through constitutional rights.  Def understands waiver of rts.  Court accepts waiver of rights and accepts plea.  Court finds def guilty and imposes $443.50.  Gives def 60 days to pay.  Def requests to be added to payplan.  Def to report to booking to be printed.  Must also provide DNA sample.  Adj.  1:25 p.m.  klr

10:17 AM Defendant Olen Mack Brewer not in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls cases.  22CT9 also called.  DA has no information why def not present.  No mail was returned.  Def's responsibility to contact court with address.  Court authorizes warrant.  $500 cash/Monday following arrest to quash.  Adj.  10:19 a.m.  klr
Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:08 AM Defendant Olen Mack Brewer in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def indicates has not contacted PD yet.  Court questions why.  Court explains process.  Def indicates he is still getting an attorney.  Def pleads NG.  Set for PTC on 5/18 at 11:00 a.m.  DA to send discovery and offer letter to def.  Address provided along with email to DA.  Adj.  9:10 a.m.  klr
Adjourned initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:21 p.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def appears in person.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Def failed to appear this a.m., but appeared this afternoon.  Court rescinds authorization for warrant from this a.m.  Complaint provided to def.  Public def info also given.  Def indicates is going to be applying for public def.  Case is set for initial appearance.  Court also explains process for court appointed attorey.  Def understands process.  Initial appearance to be set for 5/2/22 at 9:00 a.m.  DA requests signature bond.  Bond is set at $500 signature bond with provision that def not to be present at Pat's Foods in Hurley, WI.  Adj.  1:28 p.m.  klr
Def shall not be present at Pat's Foods in Hurley, WI.

09:55 AM Defendant Olen Mack Brewer not in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court provides background.  DA requests warrant.  Court grants as requested.  Can post $500 cash/following Monday.  Adj.  9:56 a.m.  klr
